intro: Bertolonia legrellei, commonly known as the Cape York daisy, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow petals and green center make it a striking addition to its natural habitat. Bertolonia legrellei is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
